steps.name: Step: 1
steps.text: Start by preparing a glass (ideally a highball glass) by running a lime wedge around the rim and dipping it into a small plate of salt to coat the edge

steps.name: Step: 2
steps.text: Fill the glass with ice cubes

steps.name: Step: 3
steps.text: Pour in the tequila, followed by the grapefruit juice and lime juice

steps.name: Step: 4
steps.text: Add a pinch of salt to the mixture

steps.name: Step: 5
steps.text: Gently top off the drink with soda water, preferably grapefruit soda water for an extra citrusy kick

steps.name: Step: 6
steps.text: Stir the drink gently to mix all the ingredients

steps.name: Step: 7
steps.text: Garnish with a slice of grapefruit or a lime wedge, and enjoy your refreshing Paloma!

steps.name: Step: 8
steps.text: Smoked Salt Rim: Elevate the traditional salt rim by using smoked salt. The smoky flavor adds a subtle depth that beautifully complements the earthy notes of the tequila while contrasting with the bright grapefruit and lime. For an even more elevated experience, try a mix of smoked salt and Tajín for a slight chili kick.

steps.name: Step: 9
steps.text: Fresh Grapefruit Peel Zest: Before juicing your grapefruit, zest a bit of the peel directly into the glass. The essential oils released from the fresh peel will intensify the aroma and give the Paloma a more complex citrus profile, adding a dimension that bottled grapefruit juice can't achieve.

steps.name: Step: 1
steps.text: Begin by pouring the desired amount of absinthe into your glass of choice, setting the stage for your classic cocktail

steps.name: Step: 2
steps.text: Next, place a cube of sugar on a slotted absinthe spoon, ensuring it rests securely across the top of the glass; this will add a subtle sweetness to the drink

steps.name: Step: 3
steps.text: Then, gradually drip iced water over the sugar cube using an absinthe fountain, or improvise with a bottle of chilled mineral water by piercing a small hole in the cap, allowing the sugar to dissolve and mix into the absinthe

steps.name: Step: 4
steps.text: Aim for a 1:1 ratio of water to absinthe, but feel free to adjust the amount of water if you're working with full-strength absinthe to achieve a more palatable dilution

steps.name: Step: 5
steps.text: Continue this process until the absinthe becomes opaquely milky white, a transformation known as "louching", marking the perfect time to add ice

steps.name: Step: 6
steps.text: Give the concoction a gentle stir to blend the ingredients and chill the drink, then prepare to serve your beautifully crafted absinthe cocktail

steps.name: Step: 7
steps.text: Use a high-quality absinthe with a good balance of herbs and anise to ensure the most authentic and rich flavor experience.

steps.name: Step: 8
steps.text: Pre-chill the water used in the drip; ice-cold water helps achieve the perfect louche and balanced flavor.
